question: [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Field: file_store_config] [Storage Exhaustion] Does the configuration limit maximum file sizes or storage quotas to prevent an attacker from filling the disk with malicious file store data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Field: file_store_config] [Remote File Store] If file_store_config supports remote storage (S3, GCS), are there proper authentication and encryption checks to prevent unauthorized access or data exfiltration? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Field: enable_cache_compression] [Compression Bomb] When enable_cache_compression is true, is there validation against zip bombs or compression ratio attacks where small compressed data expands to enormous sizes causing memory exhaustion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Field: enable_cache_compression] [Compression Algorithm] Does the compression implementation (Lz4CompressedProto) have known vulnerabilities or implementation bugs that could be exploited when processing malicious compressed data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Function: default_enable_cache_compression()] [Default Security] Is the default value of false for compression secure, or does it expose uncompressed transaction data to interception or increased network attack surface? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Derive: Clone] [Deep Clone Safety] When IndexerGrpcCacheWorkerConfig is cloned, are all nested structures (Url, RedisUrl, file_store_config) properly deep-cloned, or can shallow copying create aliasing bugs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Derive: Serialize] [Sensitive Data Serialization] When the config is serialized, are sensitive credentials in redis_main_instance_address properly redacted or encrypted? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Derive: Deserialize] [Malformed Data] Can malformed or malicious serialized data bypass serde's type safety and cause memory corruption or undefined behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Attribute: deny_unknown_fields] [Version Compatibility] Does deny_unknown_fields cause failures when upgrading to newer config versions, potentially causing indexer outages during protocol upgrades? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Worker::new() Attack Surface] When passing fullnode_grpc_address to Worker::new(), can an attacker exploit vulnerabilities in the Worker's connection establishment to trigger remote code execution on the fullnode? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Worker State Corruption] If Worker::new() partially succeeds but fails to initialize all components, could this leave the worker in an inconsistent state that causes cache corruption when run() is called? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Configuration Immutability] After Worker is created with configuration values, can those values be modified externally leading to time-of-check-time-of-use (TOCTOU) vulnerabilities? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Worker Lifecycle] Does the Worker properly clean up resources (Redis connections, gRPC streams, file handles) when run() returns or panics, or are there resource leaks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Error Propagation] Does the .context() error wrapping on lines 54 and 58 properly propagate all error information without losing critical security context? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Panic Handling] Is there a panic handler at a higher level to recover from the expect() panic on line 59, or will the entire process crash taking down the indexer service? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Async Error Safety] Are errors in the async run() function properly propagated to callers, or can they be silently dropped causing cache inconsistencies? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Trait: RunnableConfig] [Trait Safety] Does the RunnableConfig trait implementation properly enforce security invariants, or can trait methods be called in unsafe orders causing vulnerabilities? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_server_name()] [Identifier Uniqueness] Is the hardcoded 'idxcachewrkr' server name unique enough to prevent naming conflicts that could cause log confusion or monitoring issues in security incident response? [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Trait: RunnableConfig] [Async Trait Safety] Are there race conditions in the async_trait implementation where concurrent calls to run() could cause undefined behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Function: new()] [Move Semantics] Are ownership and move semantics properly implemented to prevent use-after-move bugs when passing configuration to Worker? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Type: Url] [Type Confusion] Can the Url type be coerced or cast to incompatible types causing type confusion vulnerabilities in unsafe code blocks? (Medium)
